page.title: 16SPRINGFIELD & CAESAREAN CLUB
page.content: {Springfield}is Jersey's main {football {stadium.}League matches are played there,and the {Muratti,}the annual match between {Jersey}and {Guernsey } is held there every other year. Originally built for cattle shows, the Stadium was used as a first aid centre during the war and a car crushing plant. Now, apart from football, the stadium is used for cattle and dog shows, darts competitions and {Bingo.} {The Caesarean Croquet and Lawn Tennis {Club.}In spite of the club's long name,you can no longer play croquet nor can you play tennis on grass. The croquet lawns have been turned into a car-park and there are seven{shale {courts }and 3 grey-green courts. A new club house was built on the 5th of September 1980 to replace an old shed. Caesarean is {Latin }for Jersey which has given the club its name.
